channel.title: Computer Question!
channel.description: I am using a Compaq Mini, 110C-1110SD. When i got this, there wasn't a special formatting CD in the box. I have another ones, but when i format the whole computer (removing everything in C:\ and reinstall it with the CD), is there a chance very important things like explorer.exe and files for internet etc. could go away and that i need to throw away the laptop, or will nothing happen?

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

xweetok599:

I have it, but doesn’t it need a driver for the USB cd device? And like i sayd, i can’t install drivers.

It requires no drivers to install.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @TelenimScape TelenimScape
item.description:
@TelenimScape wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:8, topic:338587”]Just order or burn an OS to a CD, stick it in, open the boot menu, select boot from disk, install, done.[/quote]This, and I suggest Linux for awesomeness.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Just order or burn an OS to a CD, stick it in, open the boot menu, select boot from disk, install, done.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xweetok599:

Dude, i mean explorer.exe, not Iexplorer.exe. Without explorer.exe i can’t see anything, only the background, and as far as i know i can’t install drivers (like the mouse) etc. BTW: I didn’t throw it away, it is in a box.

And why can’t you re-install either windows or another OS like Linux on it? One windows error doesn’t mean you have to stop using your computer, if that was the case no one would be using any computers.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

Dude, i mean explorer.exe, not Iexplorer.exe. Without explorer.exe i can’t see anything, only the background, and as far as i know i can’t install drivers (like the mouse) etc. BTW: I didn’t throw it away, it is in a box.

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:338587”][quote author=xweetok599 link=topic=434974.msg3194390#msg3194390 date=1272634634]

Usualy when you buy a new computer you get CDs with drivers and utilities for your motherboard and stuff, and you’ll probably need an “ethernet controller” which can be found in one of those CDs. If you don’t have it then you can just google, download, burn and install.

But is there a chance files like explorer will go? Once i tried to restore (not format with a CD), and explorer.exe didn’t run, computer = bye-bye.
[/quote]

So you threw away a perfectly good computer because “explorer.exe wouldn’t run”? That isn’t very smart. Did you try re-installing windows? [/quote]
Also he could of tried download anohter web broswer.
(From buying a disk, or downloading it from friends comp to his, like transfering the file)

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xweetok599, post:3, topic:338587”][quote author=Mitko link=topic=434974.msg3194387#msg3194387 date=1272634322]
Usualy when you buy a new computer you get CDs with drivers and utilities for your motherboard and stuff, and you’ll probably need an “ethernet controller” which can be found in one of those CDs. If you don’t have it then you can just google, download, burn and install.
[/quote]
But is there a chance files like explorer will go? Once i tried to restore (not format with a CD), and explorer.exe didn’t run, computer = bye-bye.[/quote]

So you threw away a perfectly good computer because “explorer.exe wouldn’t run”? That isn’t very smart. Did you try re-installing windows?

Read full topic
